page.title: 17RUSKINGTON PAST AND PRESENT4
page.content:
ancient structure was demolished to make way for a modern salon. In the nineteen thirties, a Dr. Wheelan had his surgery in a large Tudor style house called the "Paddocks". He was succeeded by Dr. Smallhorn whose eventual partner was Dr. Gibson. Their surgery was moved to Glebe house in Manor Street where the practise continued until the nineteen seventies when a purpose-built surgery located on the corner of Manor Street and Church View served as their new premises. The Ruskington Medical Group now comprises three doctors; Chambers, Jones and Price.
continued-
